Description: Black –topped jar of Nile silt pottery with a small flat base, convex walls and small lip rim, coated with red slip and fine burnished, rim and upper body blackened.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Shape similar to Black-topped red ware B74b in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery For the excavations at Naqada see W.M.F. Petrie, Naqada and Ballas (London 1896).
